intro: Chouardia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. The plants typically feature showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a contrasting throat. They are herbaceous perennials that thrive in well-drained soils and full sunlight. The genus is named in honor of the French botanist Jean Chouard.
